sub_topic: Determining the length of a diagonal in a rectangular prism.
message_1: A rectangular prism has a length of 10 cm, width of 8 cm and height of 6 cm. Determine the length of the diagonal of the rectangular prism.
message_2:
To find the length of the diagonal of a rectangular prism, we can use the 3D Pythagorean theorem. The formula is:

Diagonal = √(length² + width² + height²)

In this case, the length is 10 cm, the width is 8 cm, and the height is 6 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Diagonal = √(10² + 8² + 6²)
Diagonal = √(100 + 64 + 36)
Diagonal = √(200)

The length of the diagonal of the rectangular prism is √(200) cm, which is approximately 14.14 cm.
